message: I'm probably doing the same! I was assuming I'd need to grab a cab to a big store like Best Buy, but haven't looked for one on the map yet. Do you already know what you want, or are you still researching?
I'll decide on the spot, depending on what's avalaible. I don't _have_ to buy it, but my wife needs a new laptop soonish, and the exchange rates mean there's a good deal to save
I'm intending to pick up a (non-Mac) laptop while I'm over - does anyone have a suggestion of where to go (sans car)?

I driving in from Nashville, so might be able to provide transportation.  Our company has been buying laptops from office supply chains (Staples, Office Depot, Office Max) and installing Ubuntu with good results.

There should be office supply places downtown. I'm not sure about the nearest Best Buy, but there is a lot of other shopping in the Buckhead area and that's accessible by MARTA rail. There's a Fry's north of town, but you'd definitely need a car to get there.
MARTA to Lindbergh where there is a BestBuy. There are some more off the shelf places Near GaTech on Northside (ginstar computers). Also other stores (Staples @ Midtown, Target @ Atlantic Station)
@tartley @haard I'm doing the same too, let me know!
*Office Depot at Midtown; Also, the GT or GaState bookstores might have some of the pricier dells and macs.
There is a Frys north of town by quite a bit but could be worth it?

@tartley @fitoria do you have a time in mind? I'll only be in Atlanta for the main conference, but if past performance is any indication, during three full days of conference there's need for a breather... still, if you're intending to go before or after the conference, no worried. Regarding where to go, considering I was nine last time I was in the US, I have no idea whatsoever what the names you are dropping mean... =)
Hey. I don't have a time in mind yet. Headed for the airport right now...
@haard @tartley I'll be at ATL for the main conference too and one day after for a coding sprint. Why don't you put a date and time? :-)
for the uninitiated Frys is a tech superstore (originated on the west coast) has just about everything,, disks, systems odd parts ... stuff you did not know you needed..
I looked up in the map and the BestBuy seems to be close enough to go by MARTA.
I'll love to tag along for this. I want to buy several small tech gadgets.
@tartley @fitoria @elpargo I'll probably go sometime before lunch today. If anyone else want's to, how to get in touch?
I went by Office Depot while I was in the area to get a SIM card. They had nothing good... try to organize something for this (friday) evening?
@haard @tartley @elpargo let's meet today at 6pm, network sucks!! I have a blue shirt
Meet outside the hotel bar? I have jeans, white shirt, and might be the blondest natural blonde around =)
Several people have suggested bestbuy, so why not? All my knowledge of shopping for electronics in the US is from this thread...
I want to buy a cheap digital camera, are you going (or already go?) to bestbuy?
Order on amazon if you are here till next week it will be cheapest
I don't think I can make it today got at least 3BOFs I want to go to
I'll be down in five and see if I can find anyone else, otherwise I'll try tomorrow
Hey I just saw this, sorry I missed you guys. Did anyone go? Find anything good?

I found no one down there, so at least not me. Might try to go Sunday afternoon instead. Reach me at fredrik.haard(on)gmail.com on googletalk for more responsive chatting (missing that android app...)
@haard there is an app. Convorsation it's a direct download and a bit buggy but works.
I may go. I'm having second thoughts.
I'll be leaving for Best Buy in Buckhead from the lobby at ~1435 (after the talks). 16 minutes by MARTA according to Google Maps
Can it be a bit after the lightibg talk? My room mate is giving one :)
I'll go after the sprints introductions.  (~ 4 pm)
Or just after that talk
@elpargo r u still in the hotel?
I'll be in the lobby, im the guy in the image of my profile.
